definition: laser (loanword used in Taiwan)/also written 鐳射|镭射

sentences.english: I don't have a scar because the doctors operated on me with a laser.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有留疤的原因是因爲醫生是用雷射幫我開刀的。

sentences.english: The excitation source was a flashlamp pumped rhodamine tunable dye laser .
sentences.chinese: 激發源爲閃光燈泵可調諧若丹明染科雷射器。

sentences.english: We now shoot out laser light into a leaf.
Scientists are even working on a plasmonic analog to a laser.
sentences.chinese: 科學家甚至也在開發等同於雷射的電漿子裝置。
用雷射導引的飛彈非常精確。

sentences.english: A laser light that spans an octave enables certain very useful tricks.
sentences.chinese: 橫跨一個八度的雷射光可以延伸出一些很有用的技術。

sentences.english: Indispensable as lasers seem to be, they have their drawbacks .
sentences.chinese: 雖然雷射似乎不可或缺，但也有其不利之處。

sentences.english: Just shine a laser light or throw a ping pong ball.
sentences.chinese: 只要閃動雷射光或丟顆乒乓球就好。

sentences.english: In this study, a nano-scale detection and movement system integrating with the optical tweezers system was developed.
sentences.chinese: 雷射光鉗是一項利用光壓特性的研究技術。

sentences.english: The welds on the board are scanned with lasers for defects.
sentences.chinese: 電子版上的焊縫會用雷射光來檢查有沒有瑕疵。

sentences.english: Other instruments sense a stone's photoluminescence in laser light.
sentences.chinese: 其他儀器則是檢測寶石在雷射照射之下發出的冷光。

sentences.english: See the laser eyes reflection on the floor ?
sentences.chinese: 看見地板上我的雷射眼反射嗎？

sentences.english: Laser diodes are even more finicky and cannot tolerate so many defects.
sentences.chinese: 雷射二極體更容易受影響，無法容許這麼多的缺陷。

definition: laser (loanword)/Taiwanese term for 激光[ji1 guang1]
laser (loanword)/Taiwanese term for 激光[ji1 guang1]
